trans-unit.source: A block-level flow content element which enables <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> elements (i.e. a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Button"></xref>) to be embedded (hosted) in flow content.
A <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> element (i.e. a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button>) may be embedded directly in flow content by enclosing it in a BlockUIContainer (see example below).
An BlockUIContainer may directly host no more than one <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> child.
However, the child element hosted by an BlockUIContainer may host children of its own.
Initializes a new, empty instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.BlockUIContainer"></xref> class.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.BlockUIContainer"></xref> class, taking a specified <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> object as the initial contents of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.BlockUIContainer"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> object specifying the initial contents of the new <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.BlockUIContainer"></xref>.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> hosted by the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.BlockUIContainer"></xref>.
An <xref:System.Windows.Documents.BlockUIContainer> may directly host no more than one <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> child.
However, the child element hosted by an <xref:System.Windows.Documents.BlockUIContainer> may host children of its own.

In [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_titlexaml](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)], wrapping a <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> in an <xref:System.Windows.Documents.BlockUIContainer> is equivalent to setting that <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> as the value of the Child property.
